column4: woot, budman listen to bit_seqz, im on my mac laptop right now and no where near a ubuntu box except over ssh

d*
yeah... took me all weekend, but i am running breezy 64
haha, i hear ya, what'd you have problems with?
ndiswrapper, wrong drivers for the wifi (not ubuntu's fault), acpi hell
goodluck with all that.... my main issue has been with firefox
mostly wifi/laptop stuff
yeah, you have to use non-free version of flash for it to work right with a lot of sites.
even in 64?
yeah, no flash on my 64bit lappy yet :(
yeah, i just installed the 32 bit firefox and am running 32 bit JRE and Flash with that
breezy i368 installed pretty easy... but dapper and breezy 64 both were frustrating!
lol.... im still piecing mine together
yeah, I had to add a repos from some dude to get enlightenment, and eterm working...
oh hells yeah... gots to have my E!
have you figured out how to get yout booot time down? mine takes 2+ minutes with an athlon 64 x2 3800 w/ a gb of ram and a SATA II
who 2 minutes! somethings wrong, check your logs/dmesg!
well, im loading crazy stuff like bluetooth and i have no idea how to turn it off
its probably sitting at boot waiting for something (like the network that never comes up...) you can hit ctrl-c to skip, and move on...
im spoiled by slackware/gentoo where i edit my own scripts
yeah.. me too... ive been using ubuntu a lot for about 3 months now...
